oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Corn crib on the Hiram Neal farm
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Corn cribs; Granaries; Log buildings
Agriculture; Granaries
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Looking Back at Tennessee Photograph Collection
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A corn crib is a granary used to dry and store ears of corn. The typical corn crib had slats in its walls. These slatted sides allowed air to circulate through the corn, both drying it and helping it to stay dry.
